item.title: [PHP]Choice Finder
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Zack77:

Once again, retard. It’s not WHAT the output is, it’s WHAT IT MEANS. Lets say you have some kind of question on a test saying…You have a red shirt, blue shirt and a pink shirt; you have yellow socks, red socks and blue socks; you have blue jeans, purple jeans and pink jeans, how many total choices are there? Show all work. The output of that simple method will both give you the answer and give you the work, ie: Italian->Bologna->Swiss from the given example. Of course it’s easy to modify to fit any situation if you have even the slightest bit of a brain.

So I’m retarded for posting what your script does but not posting how not useful it is? And I do have the slightest bit of brain, if i didn’t I wouldn’t have been able to work out what the script does.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP]Choice Finder
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

This:

[quote=“Zack77, post:1, topic:286784”]Very basic, just needed it for a question so I did it quick lol…
[php]

<?php $breads = array("Rye", "Wheat", "Italian"); $meats = array("Turkey", "Ham", "Bologna"); $cheeses = array("American", "Swiss"); $i = 0; foreach($breads as $bread) { foreach($meats as $meat) { foreach($cheeses as $cheese) { $i++; echo($bread.'->'.$meat.'->'.$cheese.'
'); } } } echo('Total Choices: '.$i); ?>

[/php]

It should be easy for anyone to simply edit it so it can be used for any situation, etc etc…[/quote]

Makes This:

[quote=".Unlimited, post:17, topic:286784"]Rye->Turkey->American
Rye->Turkey->Swiss
Rye->Ham->American
Rye->Ham->Swiss
Rye->Bologna->American
Rye->Bologna->Swiss
Wheat->Turkey->American
Wheat->Turkey->Swiss
Wheat->Ham->American
Wheat->Ham->Swiss
Wheat->Bologna->American
Wheat->Bologna->Swiss
Italian->Turkey->American
Italian->Turkey->Swiss
Italian->Ham->American
Italian->Ham->Swiss
Italian->Bologna->American
Italian->Bologna->Swiss
Total Choices: 18[/quote]

So how am I wrong in posting that your script does in its present form does?

Read full topic

Show all work. The output of that simple method will both give you the answer and give you the work, ie: Italian->Bologna->Swiss from the given example. item.title: [PHP]Choice Finder
item.dc:creator: @Zack77 Zack77
item.description:
@Zack77 wrote:

Very basic, just needed it for a question so I did it quick lol…
[php]

<?php $breads = array("Rye", "Wheat", "Italian"); $meats = array("Turkey", "Ham", "Bologna"); $cheeses = array("American", "Swiss"); $i = 0; foreach($breads as $bread) { foreach($meats as $meat) { foreach($cheeses as $cheese) { $i++; echo($bread.'->'.$meat.'->'.$cheese.'
'); } } } echo('Total Choices: '.$i); ?>

[/php]

It should be easy for anyone to simply edit it so it can be used for any situation, etc etc…

Read full topic
